Articles.Content: Alright. I tried the toolbar icons myself and it didn't work. None of the icons work. I did the context menu and the part doesn't even deploy. I tried updating toolbar and that didn't work. Please help.

Alright. I tried the toolbar icons myself and it didn't work. None of the icons work. I did the context menu and the part doesn't even deploy. I tried updating toolbar and that didn't work. Please help.

So you have toolbar icons, but they don't do anything?

In your Kerbal Space Program\GameData\, you should have:

000_Toolbar

...

SCANsat

SCANsatRPM

...

is that right?

In your Kerbal Space Program\GameData\, you should have:

000_Toolbar

...

SCANsat

SCANsatRPM

...

is that right?

Yes that is correct.

Yes that is correct.

OK. I do not intend to patronize you, but I just happened to have made some animated GIFs showing the process of using SCANsat with the toolbar:

At which stage does this go wrong? Are the SCANsat buttons not available to be added to the toolbar? Are they added, but they still don't work?
They are added to the actual toolbar but do nothing. And no worries, I just want to get this sorted.

They are added to the actual toolbar but do nothing. And no worries, I just want to get this sorted.

That sounds like it could be an actual bug. Can you tell me what version of the toolbar you're using? You can look in KSP.log.
It is the most recent version. 1.7.1 I updated it a few days ago before I discovered and installed this mod.

I did the context menu and the part doesn't even deploy.

The right-click menu shows options but the parts don't deploy? These are the animated parts, the RADAR, SAR or multispectral scanner?

This doesn't sound like something specific to toolbar.

Do you see anything in the debug menu (alt+F2) when you click on the right-click menu buttons or the toolbar buttons?

The right-click menu shows options but the parts don't deploy?

Yes. But they do deploy in the VAB preview if that means anything. I'm going to check the debug log now.

EDIT: this seems to keep showing up.

[Exception]: NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object

Edited May 18, 2014 by zwolf721
OK, I'm going to use the next two posts to mockup the first post threads, and then we go for it.

edit: deleted because it's done.

Edited May 18, 2014 by technogeeky
You're wonderful. Really, you are. So glad this mod is getting much needed love.

Yes. But they do deploy in the VAB preview if that means anything. I'm going to check the debug log now.

EDIT: this seems to keep showing up.

[Exception]: NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object

Have you tried version 5? Or the latest release of version 6? It sounds like either the plugin isn't loading correctly or something is corrupted. It's also possible that something else is affecting SCANsat, but I'm not sure what could do so.
I have tried it with both version 5 and the new release of version 6. Nothing.

I have tried it with both version 5 and the new release of version 6. Nothing.

Try it without the toolbar installed at all. Just SCANsat and SCANsatRPM.

If that fails, then I can only suggest to redownload KSP itself.

Before that, though, it would help if you post your KSP.log and/or some screenshots of what is happening (or not happening).

massive thanks to the maintainers of this plug-inn it really needed it

keep up the awesome work its looking great

As a new thread was opened to provide and discuss further updates of SCANsat mod (link here), any further posts about SCANsat should be directed over there.

Damny, you did an excellent work with this mod, we miss news about you and what you would have liked this mod to become.

If you return and like so, you can PM any mod to have this thread reopened.

Thread closed.
